title: Fix Skip Link Visibility - A11y Issue
description: ## Problem The 'Skip to main content' link is always visible at the top of every page instead of being hidden until keyboard focus. ## Purpose of Skip Links Skip links are an accessibility feature (WCAG 2.1 requirement) that allow keyboard/screen reader users to bypass repetitive navigation and jump directly to main content. They should be: - Visually hidden by default - Visible only when focused via keyboard (Tab key) - First focusable element on the page ## Current Behavior - Link is ALWAYS visible - Takes up visual space at top of page - Looks like a bug to sighted users ## Acceptance Criteria - [ ] Skip link hidden by default (`sr-only` class) - [ ] Visible on keyboard focus (`focus:not-sr-only`) - [ ] Positioned at top-left when visible - [ ] High contrast styling when visible - [ ] Links to `#main-content` anchor - [ ] Main content has `id="main-content"` and `tabindex="-1"` - [ ] Focus moves to main content when activated ## Implementation ```svelte Skip to main content ``` ## Testing 1. Load page - skip link NOT visible 2. Press Tab once - skip link appears at top-left 3. Press Enter - focus jumps to main content 4. Press Tab again - skip link disappears 5. Screen reader announces link correctly

title: Queue Page Merge Queue Display
description:
## Context

The Queue page at `/queue` should show the merge queue status from refinery.

## Data Sources

The gt dashboard fetches PRs via gh CLI:
```bash
gh pr list --repo <repo> --state open --json number,title,url,mergeable,statusCheckRollup
```

For local merge queue, check bd for merge_request type issues or refinery mail.

## Requirements

1. Create `src/routes/queue/+page.server.ts`
2. Fetch open PRs or merge queue items
3. Use QueueLayout component (already exists)
4. Show: PR number, title, CI status, mergeable status
5. Color code: green (ready), yellow (pending), red (conflict/fail)

## Simplified Approach

For MVP, just show a summary:
- Number of items in queue
- List any open issues with type=merge_request

```bash
bd list --type=merge_request --status=open --json
```

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Queue page shows merge queue status
- [ ] Items display with title and status
- [ ] Color coding for status
- [ ] Empty state when queue is empty
- [ ] Error handling for failed fetches
close_reason: Queue page now fetches real merge queue data via bd list. Shows empty state, color-coded status indicators.

## Problem Current navbar lacks modern industrial aesthetic. Missing glow effects, proper active states, and visual polish. ## Current Issues - Basic styling without gas-town industrial feel - Active state indicator too subtle - Missing backdrop blur on some states - Icons (currently emojis) need replacement (see gt-ottv) - Overflow menu needs polish ## Reference Design (gas-town-control) ```tsx

``` ## Acceptance Criteria - [ ] Navbar has `backdrop-blur-md` glass effect - [ ] Active nav item has glowing underline indicator - [ ] Active item text color is `text-gas-primary` (#00DBA8) - [ ] Hover states with smooth transitions - [ ] Labels are uppercase with letter-spacing - [ ] Proper safe-area padding for notched devices - [ ] Overflow 'More' menu has similar styling - [ ] Touch targets minimum 44x44px ## Testing 1. Navigate between pages - active state updates 2. Active item has visible glow effect 3. Backdrop blur visible when scrolling content behind 4. Mobile: safe area respected on iPhone 5. Overflow menu opens/closes smoothly 6. All items accessible via keyboard

title: Agent Detail Page
description:
## Context

The Agent Detail page at `/agents/[id]` is a placeholder. Show detailed info for a specific agent.

## Data Sources

1. `gt status --json` - Get agent list, find by id
2. `gt peek <agent>` - Get recent output from agent's tmux session
3. `gt mail inbox --actor=<agent>` - Get agent's unread mail (optional)

## Agent ID Format

The `[id]` param will be the agent's session name or address:
- Infrastructure: `hq-mayor`, `hq-deacon`
- Rig agents: `gastown_ui-witness`, `gastown_ui-refinery`
- Polecats: `gastown_ui-polecat-furiosa`

## Requirements

1. Create `src/routes/agents/[id]/+page.server.ts`
2. Parse id param to find agent in gt status output
3. Optionally call gt peek for recent activity
4. Use AgentDetailLayout component (already exists)
5. Show: name, role, status, current work, recent output

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Detail page loads for valid agent IDs
- [ ] Shows agent name, role, status
- [ ] Shows current hook/work if any
- [ ] Shows recent activity (from gt peek if available)
- [ ] 404 for invalid agent IDs
- [ ] Back link to /agents
close_reason: Implemented agent detail page with real data from gt status --json

title: Logs Page Live Streaming
description:
## Context

The Logs page at `/logs` should show Gas Town events from the event feed.

## Data Sources

Event files in town root:
- `.events.jsonl` - Structured events (agent starts, completions, errors)
- `.feed.jsonl` - Activity feed

Format: One JSON object per line with timestamp, type, actor, details.

## Requirements

1. Create `src/routes/logs/+page.server.ts` to read recent events
2. Parse JSONL and return as array
3. Use LogsLayout and LogEntry components (already exist)
4. Show timestamp, event type, actor, message
5. Limit to last 100 events initially
6. Optional: Add filter by type or actor

## Technical Notes

```typescript
// Read JSONL file
import { readFileSync } from 'fs';
const lines = readFileSync('.events.jsonl', 'utf-8').split('\n').filter(Boolean);
const events = lines.map(line => JSON.parse(line));
```

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Logs page shows real events from .events.jsonl
- [ ] Events display with timestamp and type
- [ ] Most recent events first
- [ ] Handles empty file gracefully
- [ ] Error state if file unreadable
close_reason: Implemented logs page with live streaming from .events.jsonl

title: Dashboard Data Integration
description:
## Context

The `gt dashboard` command (see `/Users/amrit/Documents/Projects/Rust/mouchak/gastown/internal/web/`) already provides a web dashboard at :8080. We need to connect our SvelteKit UI to the same data sources.

## Data Sources

1. **`gt status --json`** - Returns full workspace status:
   - `agents[]` - mayor, deacon with running/state/unread_mail
   - `rigs[]` - each rig with polecats[], has_witness, has_refinery, hooks[]
   - `overseer` - name, email, unread_mail

2. **`bd list --type=convoy --status=open --json`** - Convoy tracking

3. **`tmux list-sessions -F "#{session_name}|#{session_activity}"`** - Live agent activity

## Existing Components

- `DashboardLayout` - main layout with stats slots
- `AgentCard` - displays agent with name, task, status, progress, meta
- `GridPattern` - background decoration

## Files Started (review and complete)

- `src/routes/+page.server.ts` - server load calling gt status --json
- `src/routes/api/gastown/status/+server.ts` - API endpoint
- `src/routes/api/gastown/convoys/+server.ts` - API endpoint

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Dashboard shows real agents from `gt status --json`
- [ ] Stats show real counts (active agents, tasks running)
- [ ] AgentCard displays: name, current task/state, running/idle/error status
- [ ] Page refreshes data on load (SSR)
- [ ] Error state shown if gt command fails
- [ ] Remove all mock/hardcoded data from +page.svelte
close_reason: Dashboard data integration complete. Real agents displayed from gt status --json.

title: Install Lucide Icons & Replace All Icons
description:
## Task
FOUNDATIONAL: Install lucide-svelte and STANDARDIZE all icons across the ENTIRE project.

## Why Lucide?
- Consistent icon library across all components
- Tree-shakeable (only imports used icons)
- TypeScript support
- Customizable size, color, strokeWidth

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Install: bun add lucide-svelte
- [ ] Create src/lib/components/Icon.svelte wrapper for consistent sizing
- [ ] Replace ALL icons in:
  - [ ] BottomNav.svelte
  - [ ] GlobalSearch.svelte
  - [ ] AgentCard.svelte
  - [ ] Header/+layout.svelte
  - [ ] StatusIndicator.svelte
  - [ ] Toast.svelte
  - [ ] All route pages
- [ ] Remove Material Symbols link from app.html
- [ ] Remove any inline SVGs
- [ ] Standard sizes: sm=16, md=20, lg=24
- [ ] Export from index.ts

## Icon Standards
```svelte
<script>
  import { Home, Search, Mail, Settings, User, Play, Square, AlertCircle, CheckCircle, Activity, Cpu, Clock, Zap } from 'lucide-svelte';
</script>

<!-- Usage -->
<Home class='w-5 h-5' />
<Search class='w-4 h-4 text-muted-foreground' />
```

## Icon Mapping (Material  Lucide)
| Material | Lucide |
|----------|--------|
| home | Home |
| search | Search |
| mail | Mail |
| settings | Settings |
| person | User |
| play_arrow | Play |
| stop | Square |
| error | AlertCircle |
| check_circle | CheckCircle |
| schedule | Clock |
| memory | Cpu |
| bolt | Zap |
| trending_up | Activity |
close_reason: Installed lucide-svelte and replaced inline SVGs with Lucide components across 22 files

title: Replace Emoji Icons with Lucide SVG Icons
description:
## Problem
Navigation and UI components use emoji strings (, , , ) instead of Lucide SVG icons. This looks unprofessional and inconsistent.

## Affected Files
- `src/routes/+layout.svelte` (lines 28-48) - nav items use emoji strings
- `src/lib/components/BottomNav.svelte` (lines 100, 149, 180, 208) - renders icon as text
- `src/lib/components/GlobalSearch.svelte` (lines 56-66, 147-200)
- `src/lib/components/MobileDashboard.svelte` (lines 72-90)
- `src/routes/settings/+page.svelte` (lines 59-61)

## Root Cause
`lucide-svelte` is installed and `Icon.svelte` wrapper exists, but:
1. Nav items pass emoji strings instead of Lucide components
2. `BottomNav.svelte` renders `{item.icon}` as text, not components

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All navigation icons use Lucide SVG components (Home, Target, Bot, Mail, etc.)
- [ ] BottomNav accepts Lucide components, not strings
- [ ] GlobalSearch uses Lucide icons
- [ ] MobileDashboard uses Lucide icons
- [ ] Settings theme picker uses Lucide icons (Sun, Moon, Monitor)
- [ ] Icons render as clean SVG line-art, not colorful emojis
- [ ] Icon wrapper component used consistently

## Testing
1. Visual: Icons should be monochrome SVG line icons
2. Inspect element: Should see `<svg>` tags, not emoji text nodes
3. All nav items clickable and properly styled
4. Icons scale correctly at different viewport sizes

title: Agents Page Real-time Updates
description:
## Context

The Agents page at `/agents` currently shows hardcoded mock data. Connect it to real Gas Town data.

## Data Source

`gt status --json` returns:
```json
{
  "agents": [
    {"name": "mayor", "address": "mayor/", "session": "hq-mayor", "role": "coordinator", "running": true, "has_work": false, "state": "idle", "unread_mail": 2}
  ],
  "rigs": [
    {
      "name": "gastown_ui",
      "polecats": ["furiosa"],
      "has_witness": true,
      "has_refinery": true,
      "hooks": [{"agent": "gastown_ui/furiosa", "role": "polecat", "has_work": true, "bead_id": "gt-e81"}]
    }
  ]
}
```

## Existing Components

- `AgentCard` - props: name, task, status (running|idle|error|stopped), progress, meta
- `GridPattern` - background decoration
- Current page: `src/routes/agents/+page.svelte`

## Requirements

1. Create `src/routes/agents/+page.server.ts` that calls `gt status --json`
2. Transform agents + rig polecats into AgentCard format
3. Update `+page.svelte` to use data from load function
4. Show agent address as meta (e.g., "gastown_ui/polecats/furiosa")
5. Link each card to `/agents/[id]` detail page
6. Remove all mock data

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Agents page shows real agents from gt status
- [ ] Infrastructure agents (mayor, deacon) appear
- [ ] Rig agents (witness, refinery) appear per rig
- [ ] Polecats appear with their current work status
- [ ] Cards link to detail pages
- [ ] Error state if gt command fails
close_reason: Implemented: +page.server.ts calls gt status --json, +page.svelte uses load data

title: Optimize Desktop Navigation - Add Sidebar
description:
## Problem
Desktop users only have bottom navigation which is:
1. Suboptimal for large screens (wastes vertical space)
2. Requires scrolling through 'More' menu for most pages
3. Not utilizing available horizontal space

## Current Behavior
- Same bottom nav on all viewport sizes
- 16+ nav items crammed into overflow menu
- No sidebar option for desktop

## Proposed Solution
Add collapsible sidebar for desktop (1024px) while keeping bottom nav for mobile/tablet.

## Reference (Factory-style desktop)
Desktop layouts show sidebar navigation with:
- Icon + label for each item
- Collapsible to icon-only mode
- Active state with accent color
- Grouped sections (Main, Tools, System)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Desktop (1024px): Show sidebar navigation
- [ ] Tablet/Mobile (<1024px): Keep bottom navigation
- [ ] Sidebar collapsible to icon-only mode
- [ ] Collapse state persisted in localStorage
- [ ] Nav items grouped logically:
  - Main: Dashboard, Work, Agents, Mail
  - Operations: Queue, Convoys, Workflows
  - System: Rigs, Health, Logs, Settings
- [ ] Active item highlighted with primary color
- [ ] Smooth expand/collapse animation
- [ ] Keyboard navigation support (arrow keys)
- [ ] Screen reader announces navigation regions

## Testing
1. Desktop: Sidebar visible, bottom nav hidden
2. Resize to mobile: Bottom nav appears, sidebar hides
3. Click collapse button: Sidebar shrinks to icons
4. Refresh page: Collapse state persists
5. Navigate via keyboard: Focus visible, Enter activates
6. Screen reader: Announces 'Main navigation' region

title: Fix Svelte 5 Deprecation Warnings
description:
## Task
Fix all Svelte 5 deprecation warnings from build output.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Fix state_referenced_locally (16+ instances):
  - Use $derived instead of capturing initial values
- [ ] Fix slot_element_deprecated (8+ instances):
  - Replace <slot> with {@render ...} tags
- [ ] Fix script_context_deprecated (4 instances):
  - Replace context='module' with module attribute
- [ ] Fix a11y_label_has_associated_control (2 instances):
  - Add for attribute or nest input in label
- [ ] Build with zero warnings
close_reason: Fixed all Svelte 5 deprecation warnings: script_context_deprecated (4), state_referenced_locally (17), slot_element_deprecated (23), a11y_label_has_associated_control (2)
